page.title: 03Public Houses.
page.content: One interesting feature of Heywood is the large number of {Public Houses.}In our reference block alone, there are 45 public houses and hotels. At one time, the town had its own {Brewery,} the Phoenix Brewery. Although the firm was taken over and the brewery closed, the building can still be seen and even bears the old name. The oldest pubs are to be found along the main road and especially in the centre near St. Lukes. The most famous of these is the Queen Anne, but it was closely connected with the Freemasons Arms across the road. Several renewals have taken place , each one accompanied by stories of subterranean passages and old cellars used as a prison. Nowadays, the newer type of public house, with a disco, is represented by the Victoria, but the older style still remains.
